pullRequest.body:
```lean
theorem bind_congr {f g : α → Option β} {x : Option α}
    (h : ∀ a ∈ x, f a = g a) : x.bind f = x.bind g

@[congr]
theorem bind_congr' {f g : α → Option β} {x y : Option α} (hx : x = y)
    (hf : ∀ a ∈ y, f a = g a) : x.bind f = y.bind g :=
```

Other than the possibly-missing attribute, this looks good, thanks!

bors d+
I think this should be tagged `@[congr]`, if Lean allows that?

I think not. If we were to create a congr theorem, the following theorem would be more appropriate:
```lean
@[congr]
theorem bind_congr' {f g : α → Option β} {x y : Option α} (hx : x = y)
    (hf : ∀ a ∈ y, f a = g a) : x.bind f = y.bind g :=
  hx.symm ▸ bind_congr hf
```
